Package towersim.control

Class ControlTower

Object
ControlTower
All Implemented Interfaces:
Tickable
public class ControlTower
extends Object
implements Tickable
Represents a the control tower of an airport.

The control tower is responsible for managing the operations of the airport, including arrivals and departures in/out of the airport, as well as aircraft that need to be loaded with cargo at gates in terminals.

Implement this for Assignment 1

      Implement this for Assignment 1

  • Method Details

    • addTerminal

      public void addTerminal​(Terminal terminal)
      Adds the given terminal to the jurisdiction of this control tower.
      Parameters:
      terminal - terminal to add
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • getTerminals

      public List<Terminal> getTerminals()
      Returns a list of all terminals currently managed by this control tower.

      The order in which terminals appear in this list should be the same as the order in which they were added by calling addTerminal(Terminal).

      Adding or removing elements from the returned list should not affect the original list.

      Returns:
      all terminals
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • addAircraft

      public void addAircraft​(Aircraft aircraft) throws NoSuitableGateException
      Adds the given aircraft to the jurisdiction of this control tower.

      If the aircraft's current task type is WAIT or LOAD, it should be parked at a suitable gate as found by the findUnoccupiedGate(Aircraft) method. If there is no suitable gate for the aircraft, the NoSuitableGateException thrown by findUnoccupiedGate() should be propagated out of this method.

      Parameters:
      aircraft - aircraft to add
      Throws:
      NoSuitableGateException - if there is no suitable gate for an aircraft with a current task type of WAIT or LOAD
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • getAircraft

      public List<Aircraft> getAircraft()
      Returns a list of all aircraft currently managed by this control tower.

      The order in which aircraft appear in this list should be the same as the order in which they were added by calling addAircraft(Aircraft).

      Adding or removing elements from the returned list should not affect the original list.

      Returns:
      all aircraft
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • findUnoccupiedGate

      public Gate findUnoccupiedGate​(Aircraft aircraft) throws NoSuitableGateException
      Attempts to find an unoccupied gate in a compatible terminal for the given aircraft.

      Only terminals of the same type as the aircraft's AircraftType (see AircraftCharacteristics.type) should be considered. For example, for an aircraft with an AircraftType of AIRPLANE, only AirplaneTerminals may be considered.

      For each compatible terminal, the Terminal.findUnoccupiedGate() method should be called to attempt to find an unoccupied gate in that terminal. If findUnoccupiedGate() does not find a suitable gate, the next compatible terminal in the order they were added should be checked instead, and so on.

      If no unoccupied gates could be found across all compatible terminals, a NoSuitableGateException should be thrown.

      Parameters:
      aircraft - aircraft for which to find gate
      Returns:
      gate for given aircraft if one exists
      Throws:
      NoSuitableGateException - if no suitable gate could be found
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • findGateOfAircraft

      public Gate findGateOfAircraft​(Aircraft aircraft)
      Finds the gate where the given aircraft is parked, and returns null if the aircraft is not parked at any gate in any terminal.
      Parameters:
      aircraft - aircraft whose gate to find
      Returns:
      gate occupied by the given aircraft; or null if none exists
      Implement this for Assignment 1

    • tick

      public void tick()
      Advances the simulation by one tick.

      On each tick, the control tower should call Aircraft.tick() on all aircraft managed by the control tower.

      Note that the actions performed by tick() are very simple at the moment and will be expanded on in assignment 2.

      Specified by:
      tick in interface Tickable
      Implement this for Assignment 1
